title.native: 魔法つかいプリキュア！！～MIRAI DAYS～

description:
One of the anime projects to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the Precure franchise, this will be a direct sequel of Mahoutsukai Precure! aimed at grown-up fans of the anime.

Mirai Asahina, a very curious 13-year-old girl with a love for mysterious things, met a young witch named Liko during spring break. Led by miracles and magic, Mirai and Liko both transformed into the Legendary Witch "Precures"! Working together with Mirai's treasured teddy bear Mofurun and Ha-chan, a fairy born from the "Linkle Smartbook", they tried to repel the chaos that was encroaching upon the "Magic World" and "Magicless World (Human World)". However, that involved the separation of everyone.

After being miraculously reunited a few years later, Mirai and the others begin to take steps towards their futures in their respective worlds. Mirai is a college student in the Magicless World. Liko, who returned to the Magic World, is a teacher at the Magic School. Mofurun, as always, is at Mirai's side. Ha-chan exists far away, watching over the world.

However, a new disaster threatening the Magic and Magicless worlds has appeared...
Due to signs of the coming disaster, Mirai and Liko reunite for the first time in months. While attempting to resist this mysterious enemy, they both come face to face with not only their past, but their future. With the magical words "Cure Up RaPaPa!", their exciting tale is once again set into motion!

(Source: Anime News Network, Crunchyroll, edited)

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東堂いづみ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Todo)

Izumi Toudou is a collective pseudonym for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s staff.
Also the composer for the video game Phantom Kingdom.
Also the composer for the video game Phantom Kingdom.
__Yukinojou Mori__ is a poet, lyricist and composer born in Tokyo, Japan. He is affiliated with Amuse.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)

__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Website](https://taka8rie.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=236) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/taka8rie/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/taka8rie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/riery_syame/) | [YouTube](https://m.youtube.com/channel/UC9xUIUtv3pyt_s_LtCLWP_Q) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Takahashi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E6%9D%8E%E4%BE%9D)

A voice actress and singer. She won a Best Female Newcomer Award at the 10th Seiyuu Awards in 2016.

She is part of the idol group [Earphones](https://anilist.co/staff/195973/) with fellow voice actresses [Marika Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/119383) and [Yuki Nagaku](https://anilist.co/staff/119370), originally formed for the anime [Sore ga Seiyuu!](https://anilist.co/anime/21009).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Hu Tao](https://anilist.co/character/233425/) - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
- [Hikari](https://anilist.co/character/3966/Hikari) - Pokémon Masters EX (Video Game)
- Benten - Soul Tide (Video Game)
- Huma - Tower of Fantasy (Video Game)
- Diesel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (Video Game)
- Erina - Persona 5 Tactica (Video Game)
- Ren - Date a Live: Ren Dystopia (Video Game)
- Kokona - Strinova (Video Game)
- Perfumer - Arknights (Video Game)

__Height:__ 155 cm

[Website](http://king-cr.jp/artist/horie/) | [Profile](https://www.vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=8) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/horieyui-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/horieyui_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuihorie_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yui_Horie) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A0%80%E6%B1%9F%E7%94%B1%E8%A1%A3) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/4000.html) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/YuiHorieJP)

She is a voice actress and singer currently affiliated with vims. She hosts a radio show called "Horie Yui no Tenshi no Tamago" (堀江由衣の天使のたまご "Yui Horie's Angel Eggs") and is the founding member of the singing group, Aice5. She is also a member of the band Kurobara Hozonkai, with the name YUIEL. Her hobbies include shoulder massaging, reading and eating. She has been affectionately nicknamed "Hocchan" (ほっちゃん) by her Japanese fans.

**Non-anime roles:** 
- Faruzan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Freesia - Memento Mori (VG)
- Miranda - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Maiden - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Wagon - Ressha Sentai ToQger (Tokusatsu)
- Mine Aomori - Blue Archive (VG)
- Cotton Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Surtr - Arknights (VG)
- Ai-chan - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Charlotte Corday - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
Also the composer for the video game Phantom Kingdom.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [digital artist](https://anilist.co/staff/220888/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshiyama_yuu)

She got her start at Studio Muu under [Hiromi Muranaka](https://anilist.co/staff/143692/)'s guidance. Heavily influenced by the works of [Masahito Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/138566/), [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and [Masami Oobari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/). Regular presence in [Toei](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s shows, specifically the [Precure](https://anilist.co/anime/100661/) franchise.

Her animation is characterized by impact frames, dark shadows, thick outlines, and overly expressive hands.

Also a die-hard fan of insects.
